{
  "article_text": [
    "in this paper we study robust minimality of iterated function systems . by an iterated function system",
    "one means the action of the semigroup generated by a family of diffeomorphisms .",
    "the study of iterated function systems ( ifs , for short ) , besides its own importance , has a remarkable role for understanding certain ( single ) dynamical systems .",
    "for instance , one can embed an ifs in to a skew - product over the full shift with sufficient number of symbols ; and therefore in many dynamical systems exhibiting some form of hyperbolicity .",
    "let @xmath1 be two families of diffeomorphisms on a compact manifold @xmath2 .",
    "denote @xmath3 and for @xmath4 , @xmath5 write @xmath6 for the semi - group generated by @xmath7 , that is , @xmath8 .",
    "the action of the semi - group @xmath6 is called the _ iterated function system _ ( or ifs ) associated to @xmath7 and we denote it by @xmath9 . for @xmath10 , we write the orbits of the action of this semi - group as @xmath11    a sequence @xmath12 is called a branch of an orbit of @xmath9 if for each @xmath13 there is @xmath14 such that @xmath15 .",
    "we say that @xmath9 is minimal if any orbit has a branch which is dense in @xmath2 .",
    "we say that a property p holds @xmath16 robustly for @xmath9 if it holds for @xmath17 for any family @xmath18 whose elements are @xmath16 perturbations of elements of @xmath7 .    here",
    ", we prove the following    [ thm a ] any boundaryless compact manifold admits a pair of diffeomorphisms that generates a @xmath0 robustly minimal iterated function system .",
    "the number of generators in theorem  [ thm a ] is optimal .",
    "indeed , a single diffeomorphism can not be @xmath0 robustly minimal .",
    "recall that a diffeomorphism is minimal if any orbit is dense .",
    "pugh s closing lemma yields the existence of periodic points for @xmath0 generic diffeomorphisms .",
    "moreover , not every manifold admits a minimal diffeomorphism . in dimension two ,",
    "the only manifold with minimal diffeomorphisms is the torus .",
    "examples of robustly minimal iterated function systems with more generators have been constructed in @xcite and @xcite .",
    "the study of minimal ifs has important consequences to study and to construct robustly transitive diffeomorphisms .",
    "recall that a diffeomorphism is transitive if it has a dense orbit , and it is ( @xmath0 ) robustly transitive if every nearby diffeomorphism ( in @xmath0 topology ) is also transitive .",
    "some parts of the proof of theorem  [ thm a ] are closely related to the construction of blenders .",
    "the notion of blender introduced by bonatti and daz @xcite is the main tool to construct robustly transitive diffeomorphisms .",
    "the results of this paper permit us to give a straightforward and general construction of blenders and robustly transitive dynamics in arbitrary dimension along the lines of @xcite .",
    "it can be summarized as follows ( cf .",
    "theorem [ thm c ] ) :    _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ let @xmath19 be a diffeomorphism with invariant compact partially hyperbolic set @xmath20 such that @xmath21 is conjugate ( appropriately ) to an iterated function system @xmath22 . if @xmath22 is _ strongly robustly minimal _",
    ", then @xmath19 is _ robustly transitive _ on @xmath20 .",
    "_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _    the strong robust minimality of an ifs means roughly that one may change the perturbed family of maps at each iteration and still obtain dense orbit for all points ( cf .",
    "definition [ def strong ] ) .",
    "the main technical in this direction is theorem [ thm strong ] , which implies the following improvement of theorem [ thm a ] .",
    "[ thm b ] any boundaryless compact manifold admits a pair of diffeomorphisms that generates a @xmath0 strongly robustly minimal ifs .",
    "we provide two constructions that prove theorem  [ thm a ] , in sections  [ s : min ] and [ s : second ] .",
    "those constructions yield different type of examples in the application to robustly transitivity . in section [",
    "s : strong r m ] we study the strong robust minimality of ifs and then we complete the proof of theorem [ thm b ] .",
    "the connection to blenders , and an application to the construction of robustly transitive skew product diffeomorphisms , is presented in section  [ s : skew ] .",
    "in this section we prove theorem  [ thm a ] .",
    "let @xmath23 be a family of maps on the metric space @xmath24 , and @xmath25 .",

    "the following proposition is a modification of propositions 2.3 of @xcite ( see also @xcite ) .",
    "we give a short proof in section [ s : strong r m ] .",
    "[ pro ifs 1 ] let @xmath34 and @xmath35 be two open disks in @xmath36 containing @xmath37 , and @xmath38 be a diffeomorphism with @xmath39 . if @xmath40 is a contraction , then there exists @xmath41 such that for any small @xmath42 there exist @xmath43 and vectors @xmath44 such that @xmath45 where @xmath46 and @xmath47 is a branch of the orbit @xmath48 .",

    "let @xmath2 be a compact manifold of dimension @xmath57 .",
    "we refer to @xcite or @xcite for iterated functions systems in dimension one .",
    "the proof has three steps .",
    "+ * step 1 . *",
    "it is a standard consequence from morse theory that one can take a morse - smale diffeomorphism @xmath58 on @xmath2 with a unique attracting fixed point @xmath59 .",
    "we assume that the norm of @xmath60 is sufficiently close to one ( i.e. @xmath59 is a @xmath53-weak hyperbolic attractor with sufficiently small @xmath53 ) .",
    "we then modify slightly the dynamics of @xmath58 in a neighborhood @xmath34 of @xmath59 in order to obtain a new diffeomorphism @xmath61 such that it has a periodic attracting orbit @xmath62 in @xmath34 with sufficiently large period @xmath63 and with very weak attraction .",
    "the period of the attracting orbit and the rate of its weak attraction depend to the dimension of the manifold .    to do the modification",
    "we may assume that the open set @xmath34 is diffeomorphic to the product @xmath64 .",
    "if @xmath65 , then we replace the dynamics on @xmath34 by the local diffeomorphism @xmath61 on @xmath66 as in figure  [ fig ifs ] .",

    "then we modify @xmath61 on @xmath34 to be the product @xmath74 . +",
    "* step 2 . *",

    "we use the results of section  [ sec local ] .",
    "let @xmath78 be a sufficiently small neighborhoods of @xmath79 , for @xmath80 @xmath81 .",
    "we consider a local coordinate on each @xmath82 . by the assumptions , @xmath83 .",

    ", @xmath90 is defined in local coordinates as the translation by the vector @xmath91 .",

    "we call such a local set with robustly minimal dynamics , a _ blending region _ of the iterated function system .",
    "observe that @xmath99 is very close to @xmath100 and so it is morse - smale .",

    "recall that for a morse - smale diffeomorphism the manifold @xmath2 is the union of the stable manifolds of finitely many periodic points .",
    "also , the union of basins of attraction of periodic attractors for a morse - smale diffeomorphism is an open and dense subset of the manifold : the stable manifold @xmath116 for @xmath61 and the unstable manifold @xmath106 for @xmath103 are open and dense .",
    "pick @xmath51 so that @xmath103 and @xmath61 have no common periodic points , while @xmath103 maps the periodic points of @xmath61 into the basin of attraction of @xmath62 .",
    "the negative orbits of @xmath89 then cover @xmath2 .",
    "similarly for positive orbits of @xmath89 .",
    "they cover @xmath2 if @xmath100 maps the periodic points of @xmath103 into the basin of attraction of the periodic attractor for @xmath117 .",
    "since these basins of attraction are open and dense in @xmath2 , these properties can be achieved for @xmath51 arbitrarily close to @xmath118 .",
    "this completes the proof of theorem  [ thm a ] .",
    "in this section we describe an alternative argument leading to theorem  [ thm a ] .",
    "the local part of the argument , producing a blending region , is through an alternative construction .",
    "the global part , the mechanism to iterate into and out of the blending region , will be the same .",
    "we start with the construction of a minimal iterated function systems generated by affine maps on euclidean spaces .",
    "we will provide an affine contraction @xmath119 and an affine expansion @xmath120",
    "( i.e. @xmath121 is a contraction ) so that the iterated function system generated by @xmath119 and @xmath120 is minimal on all of @xmath122 .",
    "here we assume @xmath123 , compare @xcite for minimal iterated functions systems on @xmath124 generated by affine maps . moreover",
    ", @xmath125 will be a contraction and the iterated function system generated by the two affine contractions @xmath119 and @xmath126 possesses an attractor with nonempty interior .",
    "similar ideas were independently used by volk @xcite in his construction of persistent attractors for endomorphisms .    consider the rotation @xmath127 in @xmath122 , @xmath123 , @xmath128 where the sign is such that @xmath129 , i.e. , a minus sign for even @xmath130 and a plus sign for odd @xmath130 . define further the translation @xmath131 and the affine map @xmath119 on @xmath132 by @xmath133 for constants @xmath134 , @xmath135 .",

    "note that @xmath119 is a contraction by @xmath140 , while @xmath120 is an expansion as @xmath137 .",

    "the proof of theorem  [ thm a ] in section  [ ss : proof ] consists of a local part , the construction of a blending region in steps 1 and 2 , and a global part in step 3 involving a mechanism to move from the blending region to other parts of the manifold , and back , by iterating .",
    "the same construction can be followed here , where lemma  [ l : lemme ] used in a chart on the manifold provides a blending region .",
    "compare @xcite .",

    "in this section we introduce the notion of strong robust minimality for iterated function systems .",
    "let @xmath24 be a metric space , and @xmath23 be a family of maps on @xmath24 .",

    "* we also denote @xmath202 for @xmath203 .",
    "* let @xmath190 .",
    "a sequence @xmath204 is called a branch of the orbit @xmath205 if for any @xmath13 there is @xmath206 such that @xmath15 .",
    "let @xmath23 be a family ( with @xmath52 elements ) of @xmath207 diffeomorphisms of a manifold @xmath2 .",
    "a neighborhood @xmath208 of @xmath23 is the set of all families @xmath209 whose elements are @xmath16 perturbations of elements of @xmath7 .",
    "[ def strong ] we say that @xmath9 is @xmath16 _ strongly _ robustly minimal if there is a neighborhood @xmath208 of @xmath23 such that for any @xmath10 and any sequence @xmath194 in @xmath208 there is a branch of the orbit of @xmath205 which is dense in @xmath2 .",
    "it is clear that this is stronger than robust minimality defined in the introduction .",
    "we will see how this notion is natural and effective when one applies the robust minimality of ifs to construct examples of robustly transitive diffeomorphisms .",

    "the following gives a short proof for proposition [ pro ifs 1 ] .",
    "there exist a family of maps @xmath23 as in proposition [ pro ifs 1 ] such that @xmath22 is strongly robustly minimal on some open ball @xmath295 .",
    "let @xmath210 such that @xmath296 . then",
    ", we consider a cover of the closed unit ball of @xmath297 by @xmath52 balls of radius @xmath213 , i.e. , @xmath298 it follows that for @xmath43 small enough , @xmath299 to complete the proof , it is enough to apply the previous theorem for @xmath300 and the family @xmath301 , where @xmath302 .",
    "it is easy to see that the pair of diffeomorphism ( in both proofs ) of theorem [ thm a ] satisfies the hypothesis of theorem [ thm strong ] and so it generates a strongly robustly minimal ifs .",
    "following ideas developed in @xcite , we discuss relations between robustly minimal iterated function systems constructed in the previous sections and blenders .",
    "we demonstrate how , through these relations , the minimal iterated function systems provide elementary constructions of robustly transitive skew products .",
    "more precisely , we show how the constructions in this paper provide an alternative construction for one of the main results from @xcite on robustly transitive skew products ( see theorem  [ t : b ] below ) .    the material in the previous sections is readily translated to skew product systems of diffeomorphisms over shift maps ; a blending region will give rise to a symbolic blender .",
    "blenders are certain hyperbolic invariant sets used in the construction of robustly transitive dynamics , as explored in @xcite ( see also @xcite ) .",
    "the original notion of blenders is in a context of partial hyperbolicity with one dimensional central directions .",
    "the generalization of blenders to higher dimensional central directions was first considered in @xcite , where symbolic blenders and their geometric models are introduced and applied to robustly transitive dynamics in symplectic settings .",
    "a further study of their geometric and dynamical properties is in @xcite .",
    "let @xmath179 be two diffeomorphisms on @xmath2 generating a robustly minimal iterated function system as in the previous sections . for reasons of definiteness and clarity",
    "we assume the properties listed in section  [ s : proof ] .",
    "write @xmath303 , @xmath304 and let @xmath305 . recall that @xmath306 acts minimally on a set @xmath307 .",
    "more specific , there are open sets @xmath308 on which @xmath309 and @xmath70 and @xmath71 are contractions on @xmath310 .    with @xmath311 ,",
    "let @xmath312 on @xmath313 be defined by @xmath314 where @xmath315 is the left shift operator .",
    "for the one - sided symbol space @xmath316 , a map @xmath317 on @xmath318 is defined likewise , using the same formula .",
    "the symbol spaces @xmath319 and @xmath320 will be endowed with the product topology , and we write @xmath321 .",
    "a natural situation is where @xmath320 occurs , through a topological conjugacy , as an invariant set of a diffeomorphism .",
    "this gives sense to notions of ( partial ) hyperbolicity and of invariant manifolds such as stable manifolds .",
    "it will in fact be the context of our applications on robustly transitive skew product systems . henceforth , we work in the setup of diffeomorphisms @xmath322 on a compact manifold @xmath323 possessing a maximal hyperbolic invariant set in an open @xmath324 on which @xmath61 is topologically conjugate to @xmath325 on @xmath320 .",

    "suppose @xmath332 is partially hyperbolic on @xmath313 in the sense that contraction and expansion rates of @xmath325 dominate those of @xmath333 .",
    "that is , with @xmath334 denoting the splitting in stable and unstable directions for @xmath325 , @xmath335 for each @xmath336 and @xmath337 .",
    "the partially hyperbolic skew product systems in @xmath338 form an open subset of @xmath338 ; we may assume that @xmath312 is partially hyperbolic .",
    "we refer to @xcite for more on partial hyperbolicity . as a consequence of partial hyperbolicity",
    ", there are strong stable and strong unstable manifolds of points in @xmath313 that project to the stable and unstable manifolds of @xmath325 under the projection to the base space @xmath320 .",
    "these strong stable manifolds provide a strong stable lamination @xmath339 of @xmath313 . for definiteness , a local strong stable",
    "manifold is a compact part of a strong stable manifold that projects to some @xmath340 under the projection to the base space @xmath320 . likewise , strong unstable manifolds of points in @xmath313 provide a strong unstable lamination @xmath341 of @xmath313 .",
    "local strong unstable manifolds project to @xmath342 under the projection to the base space @xmath320 .",
    "a strong stable or unstable lamination of a set is called minimal if each of its leaves lies dense in the set .",
    "the maximal invariant set @xmath154 of @xmath332 in @xmath343 in the following proposition is called a symbolic blender @xcite .",
    "the local unstable set of @xmath154 is to be interpreted as the union of local strong unstable manifolds through points in @xmath154 .",
    "* @xmath332 is topologically mixing on @xmath154 , * the strong unstable lamination of @xmath154 is minimal , * any local strong stable manifold inside @xmath347 intersects the local unstable set of @xmath154 .",
    "the image @xmath348 contains @xmath349 strips @xmath350 with diameter of @xmath351 going to @xmath37 as @xmath352 and together covering @xmath353 .",
    "take an open set @xmath354 .",
    "a high iterate @xmath355 contains a strip @xmath356 in @xmath357 . by the above description of iterates",
    "@xmath348 , we see that further iterates @xmath358 contain strips in @xmath357 , that lie increasingly dense in it as @xmath352 .",

    "write @xmath376 for the continuous projection along local strong stable manifolds .",

    "we can copy the previous reasoning .",

    "this proves the proposition .      as an application of symbolic blenders from proposition  [ p : blender ]",
    "we show how it gives constructions of robustly transitive diffeomorphisms , obtaining a main result in @xcite in a straightforward manner .",
    "let @xmath385 be compact manifolds and let @xmath386 be a diffeomorphism with a compact hyperbolic locally maximal invariant set @xmath387 , on which @xmath61 is topologically mixing .",
    "below we will use the fact that unstable manifolds for @xmath61 of points in @xmath387 lie dense in @xmath387 , see e.g. ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section  18.3 ) . recall that a @xmath0 small perturbation @xmath388 of @xmath61 possesses a hyperbolic attractor @xmath389 near @xmath387 .",
    "moreover , @xmath388 restricted to @xmath389 is topologically conjugate to @xmath61 restricted to @xmath387 .",
    "let @xmath390 be a markov partition for @xmath387 , through which , @xmath391 is conjugate by @xmath392 to the full shift @xmath393 with @xmath52 symbols .",
    "[ t : b ] there is a diffeomorphism @xmath394 , @xmath395 with @xmath61 as above , that is topologically mixing on @xmath396 .",
    "moreover , @xmath19 is robustly topologically mixing in @xmath397 ; i.e. there is an open neighborhood @xmath34 of @xmath19 in @xmath397 so that each @xmath398 from @xmath34 is topologically mixing on @xmath399 .",

    "* theorem  6.5.5 ) ) .",
    "for simplicity we assume @xmath403 for now . with the smale horseshoe",
    "comes a markov partition of two sets @xmath404 covering @xmath405 , for which @xmath405 is the maximal invariant set in @xmath406 .      1 .   through the conjugation of @xmath408 with @xmath325 , the skew product system on @xmath409",
    "is given by @xmath410 where @xmath179 are as in section  [ s : proof ] , 2 .",
    "for @xmath411 , @xmath180 , @xmath412 does not depend on @xmath413 .",
    "we now consider the diffeomorphism @xmath19 restricted to @xmath409 .",
    "the repelling fixed point @xmath185 of @xmath414 in @xmath307 gives a fixed point @xmath415 for @xmath416 that is repelling in @xmath417 .",
    "this corresponds to a fixed point @xmath418 for @xmath19 that is repelling within its central fiber .",
    "similarly @xmath19 has a fixed point @xmath419 coming from the fixed point @xmath420 for @xmath416 , this fixed point is contracting within its central fiber .",
    "note that @xmath421 is dense in @xmath396 , since unstable manifolds for @xmath61 are dense in @xmath387 .",
    "we claim that @xmath422 establishing that @xmath423 lies dense in @xmath396 .",
    "namely , take a point @xmath424 and a neighborhood @xmath425 of it , iterate backwards and note that @xmath426 intersects @xmath423 by the existence of a symbolic blender of @xmath19 on @xmath409 ( compare ( * ? ? ?",
    "* lemma  1.9 ) ) .",
    "density of @xmath423 implies that @xmath332 is topologically mixing on @xmath396 , since iterates of an open set intersect the local stable manifold of @xmath419 and thus accumulate onto @xmath423 .",
    "this construction is robust under perturbations of @xmath19 , see also proposition  [ p : blender ] , proving that @xmath19 is robust topologically mixing .",
    "[ lem hps ] let @xmath394 be a skew - product diffeomorphism such that @xmath427 with @xmath61 as above , and such that @xmath428 is uniformly dominated by @xmath391 then , for any @xmath416 in a @xmath0 neighborhood of @xmath19 in @xmath429 the following holds :    * there is a unique continuation @xmath430 of @xmath431 , * @xmath432 is conjugate by @xmath433 to the @xmath0 skew product @xmath434 on @xmath435 : @xmath436 * for any @xmath337 , @xmath437 is diffeomorphic to @xmath2 and it is @xmath0 close to @xmath438 .",
    "if @xmath19 satisfies the previous lemma , then we say @xmath19 is _ robustly transitive on @xmath439 _ if for any @xmath416 some neighborhood of @xmath19 , @xmath430 is a transitive set for @xmath416 .",
    "the analogues notion will be used for topologically mixing instead of transitivity .",
    "[ thm c ] let @xmath19 as in lemma [ lem hps ] and suppose that for @xmath443 , @xmath444 and such that @xmath445 is strongly robustly minimal .",
    "then , @xmath19 is robustly transitive on @xmath439 , and the strong - unstable lamination is robustly minimal in @xmath439 .",
    "remark that theorem [ thm strong ] gives a sufficient condition to guarantee the main hypothesis of the previous theorem , i.e. an ifs being strongly robustly minimal .",
    "therefore , theorems [ thm strong ] and [ thm c ] provide a general framework to prove robust transitivity , reformulating to the role of blenders ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we prove that any compact manifold without boundary admits a pair of diffeomorphisms that generates @xmath0 robustly minimal dynamics . </S>",
    "<S> we apply the results to the construction of blenders and robustly transitive skew product diffeomorphisms . </S>"
  ]
}
